choices.E: The software installation has not been fully reconciled.
choices.A: The software installation was not completed correctly due to an incorrect workflow set-up.
choices.B: Software installation records are not associated with a software discovery model.
choices.C: The software normalization process has not yet run.
choices.D: The software discovery model is not mapped to the appropriate software model.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
It is D in my view.
The install record and the discovery model are created at the same time. The software model is the trail to the entitlement.
The link is the discovery map. Without mapping the reconciliation cannot find any entitlement/license.
I belive it's D. installation records??
Sorry, I mean B.
isn't it D?

questions.question_text: For which of the following reasons could an installation be unlicensed at the Product Result level?
By default, which ServiceNow role can only view reconciliation results?

discussion.content: sam_user can view the results and sam_admin can run the reconciliation. So the answer is B

Selected Answer: B
sam_user can view reconciliation results

Selected Answer: B
Users with the sam_admin role can run on-demand reconciliation; users with sam_user role can only view reconciliation results.
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/c_SAMReconciliation.html
it's B

questions.question_text: For products monitored by System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM), what usage data point(s) are imported for reclamation analysis?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
There are two types of data (total usage and last used) that you can extract from SCCM and import into your instance. Last used data will only show the last time the software was used during the previous month.

it's C
https://docs.servicenow.com/en-US/bundle/utah-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/sccm-software-usage.html

choices.C: Last Used and Total Usage Time

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
the correct answer is C - Product Catalog, as it's a collection of models in the environment.

(it is not service catalog, as that is a listing of goods and services an organization provides.)
C is correct

Selected Answer: C
Product Catalog - Collection of Models in the environment - models can be easily published to the Product Catalog and are then automatically published to the Service Catalog.

Selected Answer: C
Answer : C (Product Catalog)
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/vancouver-it-asset-management/page/product/product-catalog/concept/c_ProductCatalog.html
This should answer the discussion/debate for Question 96 of this Exam :)
A: Service Catalog is the right answer

questions.question_text: Which catalog provides a collection of models in the environment?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
For Software Asset Management, ServiceNowâ€™s Client Software Distribution (CSD) product facilitates software removal without user interaction. Using Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM), a scheduled job revokes un-entitled software and reclaims license rights. Utilizing this capability does not require that SCCM install the software to be removed.

Selected Answer: C
C is correct - on page 422 of the sam book that came with the course

C is correct
https://docs.servicenow.com/bundle/sandiego-it-asset-management/page/product/software-asset-management2/concept/c_SAMOptimization.html
C is the right answer

questions.question_text: Software reclamation is integrated with which of the following to automate the process of uninstalling software from devices and reclaiming those software rights?
